intro: Bejaria cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban bejaria, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Bejaria cubensis typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
